alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range; Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 26 at 9:12AM PDT until September 28 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM PDT WEDNESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SANTA BARBARA COUNTY MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS THE SOUTH COAST... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SANTA BARBARA COUNTY MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS THE SOUTH COAST... .A combination of moderately strong northerly pressure gradients, weak cold advection, and increasing winds aloft will bring critical fire weather conditions to the mountains of Santa Barbara county as well as the South Coast this evening through Wednesday morning with the possibility of the critical fire weather conditions continuing through early Thursday morning. Warm and dry conditions will occur in the foothills just above Santa Barbara and Montecito both this evening and Wednesday evening with temperatures from 75 to 85 degrees and humidity lowering to 15 to 25 percent. Gusty north winds of 50 to 60 mph or possibly higher could lead to rapid fire spread, especially in the foothill areas. This part of Santa Barbara County is particularly vulnerable to fires due to dry fuel moisture values at this time of the year. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM PDT WEDNESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SANTA BARBARA COUNTY MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS THE SOUTH COAST... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SANTA BARBARA COUNTY MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS THE SOUTH COAST... The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a Red Flag Warning FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, which is in effect from 5 PM this afternoon to 9 AM PDT Wednesday. * Winds...North 25 to 35 mph with gusts of 50 to 60 mph, strongest after dark each evening. Isolated gusts to 70 mph possible in the foothills above Montecito. * Relative Humidity...15 to 25 percent, especially during windier periods. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are likely to occur in the coming days. Residents near wildland interfaces should prepare now on what to do if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information..
